questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Match List-I with List-II:
List-I: A. K, B. KCl, C. KOH, D. Li
List-II: I. Thermonuclear reactions, II. Fertilizer, III. Sodium potassium pump, IV. Absorbent of CO₂
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
questions.concept: Uses of alkali metals and their compounds

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
R-CO-H (where R=alkyl) undergoes the following reactions:
(i) KMnO₄ → 'A' (Major Product)
(ii) A + (i) NH₂NH₂, KOH (ii) H₃O⁺ → 'B' (Major Product)
'A' and 'B' in the above reactions are:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Match List-I with List-II:
List-I Species: A. H₃O⁺, B. Acetylide anion, C. NH₄⁺, D. ClO₂⁻
List-II Geometry/Shape: I. Tetrahedral, II. Linear, III. Pyramidal, IV. Bent
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: 25 mL of silver nitrate solution (1M) is added dropwise to 25 mL of potassium iodide (1.05 M) solution. The ion(s) present in very small quantity in the solution is/are:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: When a solution of mixture having two inorganic salts was treated with freshly prepared ferrous sulphate in acidic medium, a dark brown ring was formed whereas on treatment with neutral FeCl₃, it gave deep red colour which disappeared on boiling and a brown red ppt was formed. The mixture contains:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The complex that dissolves in water as [Fe₃(OH)₂(OAc)₆]Cl is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The set which does not have ambidentate ligand(s) is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Thin layer chromatography of a mixture shows the following observation. The correct order of elution in the silica gel column chromatography is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Which of the following complex has a possibility to exist as meridional isomer?

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
In the extraction process of copper, the product obtained after carrying out the reactions:
(i) 2Cu₂S + 3O₂ → 2Cu₂O + 2SO₂
(ii) 2Cu₂O + Cu₂S → 6Cu + SO₂
is called:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For compound having the formula GaAlCl₄, the correct option from the following is:

options.text: Cl forms bond with both Al and Ga in GaAlCl₄
Oxidation state of Ga in the salt GaAlCl₄ is +3
Ga is more electronegative than Al and is present as a cationic part of the salt GaAlCl₄
Ga is coordinated with Cl in GaAlCl₄

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement-I: Methane and steam passed over a heated Ni catalyst produces hydrogen gas.
Statement-II: Sodium nitrite reacts with NH₄Cl to give H₂O, N₂ and NaCl.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Both the statements I and II are incorrect
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Both the statements I and II are correct

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The polymer X consists of linear molecules and is closely packed. It is prepared in the presence of triethylaluminium and titanium tetrachloride under low pressure. The polymer X is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R:
Assertion A: In the photoelectric effect, the electrons are ejected from the metal surface as soon as the beam of light of frequency greater than threshold frequency strikes the surface.
Reason R: When the photon of any energy strikes an electron in the atom, transfer of energy from the photon to the electron takes place.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: A is correct but R is not correct
A is not correct but R is correct
Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement I: If BOD is 4 ppm and dissolved oxygen is 8 ppm, then it is a good quality water.
Statement II: If the concentration of zinc and nitrate salts are 5 ppm each, then it can be a good quality water.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both the statements I and II are incorrect
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Both the statements I and II are correct

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For elements B, C, N, Li, Be, O and F, the correct order of first ionization enthalpy is:

options.text: Li < B < Be < C < O < N < F
Li < Be < B < C < O < N < F
B < Li < Be < C < N < O < F
Li < Be < B < C < N < O < F

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: o-Phenylenediamine reacts with HNO₂ to give 'X' as major product. 'X' is:
questions.concept: Reaction of aromatic amines with nitrous acid

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Arrange the following compounds in increasing order of rate of aromatic electrophilic substitution reaction:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: L-isomer of tetrose X (C₄H₈O₄) gives positive Schiff's test and has two chiral carbons. On acetylation, 'X' yields triacetate. 'X' also undergoes following reactions: 'X' with HNO₃ gives 'A', 'X' with NaBH₄ gives 'B' (Chiral compound). 'X' is:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For the given two nucleophilic substitution reactions, find out the correct statement from the options given below:

options.text: Reactions (I) and (II) both are of 1st order
Reactions (I) and (II) both are of 2nd order
Reaction (I) is of 1st order and reaction (II) is of 2nd order
Reaction (I) is of 2nd order and reaction (II) is of 1st order

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: 0.004 M K₂SO₄ solution is isotonic with 0.01 M glucose solution. Percentage dissociation of K₂SO₄ is ____________ (Nearest integer)
questions.concept: Osmotic pressure and van't Hoff factor

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: In an electrochemical reaction of lead, at standard temperature, if E°(Pb²⁺/Pb) = m Volt and E°(Pb⁴⁺/Pb) = n Volt, then the value of E°(Pb²⁺/Pb⁴⁺) is given by m - xn. The value of x is_________. (Nearest integer)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The ratio of spin-only magnetic moment values μₑff [Cr(CN)₆]³⁻ / μₑff [Cr(H₂O)₆]³⁺ is __________.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: A solution of sugar is obtained by mixing 200 g of its 25% solution and 500 g of its 40% solution (both by mass). The mass percentage of the resulting sugar solution is _____________ (Nearest integer)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
An atomic substance A of molar mass 12 g mol⁻¹ has a cubic crystal structure with edge length of 300 pm. The no. of atoms present in one unit cell of A is _________. (Nearest integer)
Given the density of A is 3.0 g mL⁻¹ and Nₐ = 6.02 × 10²³ mol⁻¹
questions.concept: Calculation of number of atoms in unit cell

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The ratio x/y on completion of the above reaction is ______.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: The number of hyperconjugation structures involved to stabilize carbocation formed in the above reaction is.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: A mixture of 1 mole of H₂O and 1 mole of CO is taken in a 10 litre container and heated to 725K. At equilibrium 40% of water by mass reacts with carbon monoxide according to the equation: CO(g) + H₂O(g) ⇌ CO₂(g) + H₂(g). The equilibrium constant Kc × 10² for the reaction is_____. (Nearest integer)

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
Solid fuel used in rocket is a mixture of Fe₂O₃ and Al (in ratio 1:2). The heat evolved (kJ) per gram of the mixture is ___________ (Nearest integer)
Given: ΔHf°(Al₂O₃) = –1700 kJ mol⁻¹
ΔHf°(Fe₂O₃) = –840 kJ mol⁻¹
Molar mass of Fe, Al and O are 56, 27 and 16 g mol⁻¹ respectively

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText:
KClO₃ + 6FeSO₄ + 3H₂SO₄ → KCl + 3Fe₂(SO₄)₃ + 3H₂O
The above reaction was studied at 300 K by monitoring the concentration of FeSO₄ in which initial concentration was 10 M and after half an hour became 8.8 M. The rate of production of Fe₂(SO₄)₃ is _______ × 10⁻⁶ mol L⁻¹ s⁻¹. (Nearest integer)
